metadata.title: CVE-2024-26751 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ARM:ep93xx: Add terminator to gpiod_lookup_table Without the terminator, if acon_id is passed to gpio_find() that does not exist in the lookup table thefunction will not stop looping correctly, and eventually cause an oops.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
